meanings.definition: A container made of wood for storing or transporting items.
meanings.sent1: The woodboxes in the attic hold old toys.
meanings.sent2: I bought some woodboxes to organize my tools.
meanings.sent3: The woodboxes decided to have a race to see who could hold the most items.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a maze of interconnected woodboxes, each holding a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The smell of pine from the woodboxes filled the room with a comforting scent.

meanings.definition: To place items in a wooden box for storage or transport.
meanings.sent1: She carefully woodboxes her jewelry to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: Please woodboxes the fruits before sending them to the market.
meanings.sent3: The magician woodboxes a rabbit and pulls it out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: He woodboxes his emotions away, never letting anyone see how he truly feels.
meanings.sent5: The chef woodboxes the spices in a special container to keep them fresh.
